Description: Fragment of wall of large North Ionian pottery open vase; cream slip; interior glazed; exterior: head, paw and part of body of panther to left; red eyes and red patch on body.
Curator's comments: Made up of two layers of clay, which have parted internally. Perhaps from the same vase, probably a large bowl, as British Museum 1888,0601.536f which has a similar large panther, though not the same animal.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.932)
